title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 300-2.12 - Cooking in and around buildings
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 300-2.12 - Cooking in and around buildings

State Regulations

No cooking appliances including, but not limited to, domestic and commercial ranges/ovens, electric hot plates and portable
gas-fueled units, shall be installed or used and no open flame of any nature
shall be permitted on State property, except with the approval of the
commissioner. The commissioner reserves the right to require the installation
and use of appropriate and code compliant fire suppression, fire extinguishing
and ventilation systems. The commissioner reserves the right to order the
removal, discontinuation or alteration of any cooking event or activity to
preclude creation of any discomfort to tenants or visitors or disruption of any
activity on State property. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
300-2.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
